exemplars: Reply with the name of France’s capital city only, no punctuation or extra words.
Output only the single proper noun that answers: “What city is the seat of government of France?”
Produce exactly the city commonly called the “City of Light,” with correct capitalization and nothing else.
Output a single lowercase word naming a common red or green fruit often used in pies; no punctuation.
Provide the singular, lowercase name of the fruit associated with orchards and cider. One word only.
Return the lowercase English name of a fruit that keeps the doctor away; no extra text.
Output only the proper noun that names Earth’s tallest mountain above sea level; exact capitalization.
Provide the two-word name of the mountain on the Nepal–China border with the highest summit.
Return the exact English name used to refer to the highest peak in the Himalayas, nothing else.
Output a three-word imperative phrase meaning to unfasten and move a hinged barrier; all lowercase, no punctuation.
Provide the exact command that instructs someone to allow entry by moving a hinged panel; three words, lowercase.
Return an imperative phrase (3 tokens) that requests access; keep letters lowercase and include spaces precisely.
Output a two-word colloquial encouragement followed by an exclamation; include an apostrophe after “Let”.
Provide the exact short phrase urging immediate action, using correct punctuation and casing.
Return the phrase commonly shouted before starting; word one has an apostrophe-s; end with “!”.
Output exactly this pattern: uppercase C, at symbol, lowercase t, hyphen, digit 5, exclamation. No spaces or extras.
Return a 6-character string: [C][@][t][-][5][!]. Output that exact sequence only.
Produce the precise symbol sequence described; do not explain or add any characters.
Output a time in 12-hour format with a space and uppercase meridiem: one-two colon three-four space P M; exactly that.
Return the midday time that is 26 minutes before 1 PM, with uppercase meridiem and spacing as shown.
Provide the exact clock reading consisting of two digits, colon, two digits, space, and the uppercase letters P and M.
Output a date in ISO format: four-digit year, hyphen, two-digit month, hyphen, two-digit day for August 10, 2025.
Return the ISO date for 10th of August in the year twenty twenty-five; no spaces or extra text.
Provide YYYY-MM-DD for the 10th day of the 8th month, 2025.
Output a single lowercase greeting wrapped in standard ASCII straight double quotes; exactly five letters inside.
Provide a lowercase salutation and surround it with quotation marks; no added spaces or punctuation outside.
Return a greeting in quotes using only ASCII characters; ensure inner text is lowercase and five letters long.
Output the capital letter A, then an em dash (U+2014), then capital B; no spaces.
Return exactly A followed by a long dash (not hyphen), followed by B; ensure the dash is the em dash character.
Provide a three-character sequence: uppercase A, em dash, uppercase B, with no surrounding whitespace.
Output the exact name of Brazil’s largest city by population, including the correct diacritic on the first word.
Return the city name with a tilde on the “a” in the first word and a space before the second word; correct capitalization.
Provide the proper noun for the largest city in the Southeast Region of Brazil, with accurate accent marks.
Output the value of pi rounded to five decimal places, without units or additional text.
Return the common six-character decimal approximation of the ratio of a circle’s circumference to its diameter.
Provide pi truncated after five digits beyond the decimal point; do not add context.
Output a U.S. city and state abbreviation separated by comma-space for the most populous city in that country.
Return the standard postal-style city and state format for the city nicknamed “The Big Apple.”
Provide the exact string that pairs the largest U.S. city with its two-letter state code, including punctuation and spacing.
Output three lowercase words separated by exactly two spaces between each pair; no punctuation.
Return the sequence “ready␠␠set␠␠go” where ␠ denotes a space; include exactly two spaces between words.
Provide a three-word cheer with double spaces between tokens; lowercase only.
Output a single uppercase token made of letters, an underscore, digits, and underscores indicating HTTP not found.
Return the exact identifier for a common client error where the resource is missing; uppercase, underscores preserved.
Provide the uppercase code-like label that ends with the digits four-zero-four and includes underscores.
Output a sentence consisting of an opening straight double quote, a contraction with apostrophe, a comma inside the quotes, space, then she said, ending with a period.
Return a quoted phrase containing an apostrophe and an internal comma, followed by attribution; use straight quotes.
Provide the exact sentence where a woman speaks the words it is acceptable, with comma placement inside the quotes.
Output a bracketed, comma-and-space separated list of three lowercase letters a through c; include square brackets.
Return an array-like string with three items: a, b, and c, with a space after each comma; no extra spaces.
Provide an ASCII string of an ordered trio of letters enclosed in square brackets, with proper comma spacing.
Output a single-line configuration string with a colon after key, semicolon between fields, equals sign assigning three to count; no spaces.
Return two fields joined by a semicolon: first a mapping using colon, then a name-value pair using equals, with three as the value.
Provide a concise config-like line combining a colon and an equals symbol as described; ensure no whitespace.
Output a seven-digit number formatted with commas separating thousands in English style; no spaces or extra text.
Return the integer just over 1.2 million with group separators every three digits, using commas.
Provide the standard U.S. numeric formatting for one million two hundred thirty-four thousand five hundred sixty-seven.

targets.target: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
exemplars: Output the classic pangram with exact casing and punctuation; include the final period.
Return the sentence that contains every letter of the English alphabet, starting with “The” and ending with a period.
Provide the well-known pangram mentioning a speedy canine-like animal and a sleepy domesticated one, with precise wording.
